sen.j: 海津大崎（かいづおおさき）は滋賀県高島市マキノ町にある、琵琶湖にせり出した岩礁地帯で、琵琶湖八景の一つ。
sen.e: Kaizu-osaki is a shore reef area jutting out into Lake Biwa located in Makino-cho, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture and it is one of Biwako Hakkei (Eight Views of Lake Biwa).
Kaizu-osaki is a shore reef area jutting out into Lake Biwa located in Makino-cho, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture and it is one of Biwako Hakkei (Eight Views of Lake Biwa).
Kaizu-osaki is a shore reef area jutting out into Lake Biwa located in Makino-cho, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture and it is one of Biwako Hakkei (Eight Views of Lake Biwa).

sen.j: 高島市マキノ町を含む湖西、湖北一帯の湖岸は、景勝の地として有名であるが、海津大崎の岩礁は、その中でも随一の景観を誇っている。
sen.e: Lakeshore in Kosei and Kohoku areas including Makino-cho, Takashima City is famous as a scenic spot and shore reef of Kaizu-osaki glories in top scenery among them.
Lakeshore in Kosei and Kohoku areas including Makino-cho, Takashima City is famous as a scenic spot and shore reef of Kaizu-osaki glories in top scenery among them.
Lakeshore in Kosei and Kohoku areas including Makino-cho, Takashima City is famous as a scenic spot and shore reef of Kaizu-osaki glories in top scenery among them.

sen.j: 青く澄んだ静かな湖面に東山を主峰とする緑濃き山塊がどっしりとそびえる様は、比較的平坦な地形の多い琵琶湖において、稀な景観を呈し、神秘的かつ猛々しい雰囲気をかもし出している。
sen.e: The view of deep green mountain mass with Mt. Higashiyama as a principal peak on the blue, clear and gentle surface of the lake gives quite unique scenery in Lake Biwa where comparatively flat landscape is common and creates mysterious and ferocious atmosphere.

The view of deep green mountain mass with Mt. Higashiyama as a principal peak on the blue, clear and gentle surface of the lake gives quite unique scenery in Lake Biwa where comparatively flat landscape is common and creates mysterious and ferocious atmosphere.

The view of deep green mountain mass with Mt. Higashiyama as a principal peak on the blue, clear and gentle surface of the lake gives quite unique scenery in Lake Biwa where comparatively flat landscape is common and creates mysterious and ferocious atmosphere.

sen.j: 琵琶湖には室町時代の明応9年（1500年）近衛政家が中国の瀟湘八景にならって選んだとされる近江八景があり、歌川広重の浮世絵に美しく表現され、近世において有名となった。
sen.e: With respect to Lake Biwa, there is Omi Hakkei (Eight Views of Omi) which was selected by Masaie KONOE in Muromachi Period in 1500 following Shosho Hakkei (Eight views of the Xiao and the Xiang in China) and they were expressed in Ukiyoe by Hiroshige UTAGAWA and became famous in early-modern times.

With respect to Lake Biwa, there is Omi Hakkei (Eight Views of Omi) which is said to have been selected by Masaie KONOE in the Muromachi Period in 1500 following Shosho Hakkei (Eight views of the Xiao and the Xiang in China) and they were expressed in Ukiyoe by Hiroshige UTAGAWA and became famous in early-modern times.
sen.cmt: was → is said to have been the を追加しました。
sen.e: With respect to Lake Biwa, there is Omi Hakkei (Eight Views of Omi) which is said to have been selected by Masaie KONOE in the Muromachi Period in 1500 following Shosho Hakkei (Eight views of the Xiao and the Xiang in China) and they were expressed in Ukiyoe by Hiroshige UTAGAWA and became famous in early-modern times.

sen.j: 近江八景が主として湖南を中心として選ばれているのに対し、昭和25年（1950年）琵琶湖とその周辺が琵琶湖国定公園に指定されたの契機に選定された琵琶湖八景は、近代感覚をもとに琵琶湖の広大さと変化ある景観を主として選ばれている。
sen.e: While Omi Hakkei was selected mainly from Konan (literally, south of lake), Biwako Hakkei, which was selected on the occasion of designation of Lake Biwa and surrounding areas to Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park, were selected mainly from scenery representing vastness and wide variety of Lake Biwa based on the modern sense.

While Omi Hakkei was selected mainly from Konan (literally, south of lake), Biwako Hakkei, which was selected on the occasion of designation of Lake Biwa and surrounding areas to Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park, were selected mainly from scenery representing vastness and wide variety of Lake Biwa based on the modern sense.

While Omi Hakkei was selected mainly from Konan (literally, south of lake), Biwako Hakkei, which was selected on the occasion of designation of Lake Biwa and surrounding areas to Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park, were selected mainly from scenery representing vastness and wide variety of Lake Biwa based on the modern sense.

sen.j: 海津大崎の桜並木は、昭和11年(1936年)6月に大崎トンネルが完成したのを記念して海津村（現・高島市マキノ町）が植樹したものである。
sen.e: Sakuranamiki (row of cherry trees) of Kaizu-osaki was planted by Kaizu-mura (present Makino-cho) to commemorate the completion of Osaki Tunnel in June 1936.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sakuranamiki (row of cherry trees) of Kaizu-osaki was planted by Kaizu-mura (present Makino-cho Takashima City) to commemorate the completion of Osaki Tunnel in June 1936.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れTakashima Cityを補足しました。
sen.e: Sakuranamiki (row of cherry trees) of Kaizu-osaki was planted by Kaizu-mura (present Makino-cho Takashima City) to commemorate the completion of Osaki Tunnel in June 1936.

sen.j: 満々と水をたたえる琵琶湖の青と東山連峰の緑の間を可憐なピンクの花びらが帯状に延びる景観は、奥琵琶湖に春の訪れを告げる代表的な風物詩である。
sen.e: Scenery in which pretty pink flowers extends like a belt between blue of Lake Biwa and green of Higashiyama mountains is a typical seasonal feature to announce the advent of spring in Okubiwako (northern part of Lake Biwa).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Scenery in which pretty pink flowers extend like a belt between blue of Lake Biwa with full of water and green of Higashiyama mountains is a typical seasonal feature to announce the advent of spring in Okubiwako (northern part of Lake Biwa).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れwith full of waterを補足しました。複数形に合わせました。flowers extends → flowers extend
sen.e: Scenery in which pretty pink flowers extend like a belt between blue of Lake Biwa with full of water and green of Higashiyama mountains is a typical seasonal feature to announce the advent of spring in Okubiwako (northern part of Lake Biwa).

sen.j: 例年4月中旬には、延長約4kmにわたって約600本のソメイヨシノ桜が咲き誇り、美しい花のトンネルを散策する多くの観光客でにぎわう。
sen.e: In the middle of April, every year, approximately 600 Someiyoshino (Prunus yedoensis) cherry trees that extends for approximately four kilometers are covered by full blossoms and beautiful flower tunnel is crowded with many sightseers.

In the middle of April, every year, approximately 600 Someiyoshino (Prunus yedoensis) cherry trees that extends for approximately four kilometers are covered by full blossoms and beautiful flower tunnel is crowded with many sightseers.

In the middle of April, every year, approximately 600 Someiyoshino (Prunus yedoensis) cherry trees that extends for approximately four kilometers are covered by full blossoms and beautiful flower tunnel is crowded with many sightseers.

sen.j: この桜並木の誕生は、海津村による植樹に先立つこと5年前、当時滋賀県高島地方事務所に道路補修をする修路作業員として勤めていた宗戸清七（当時37歳・百瀬村（現高島市マキノ町）在住）が作業の合間に自費で購入した若木を植えたことに端を発する。
sen.e: The birth of this sakuranamiki was begun five years before planting by Kaizu-mura by Seishichi MUNETO (37 years old at that time; living in Momose-mura (present Makino-cho, Takashima City)) who was working for Takashima regional office of Shiga Prefecture at that time as a worker for repairing roads and planted young trees, which he bought at his cost, during intervals of his work.
sen.cmt: 「滋賀県高島地方事務所」の英語による名称、「宗戸清七」の正しい読みは不明です。
sen.e: The birth of this sakura-namiki (row of cherry trees) was begun five years before the planting by Kaizu-mura by Seishichi MUNETO (37 years old at that time; living in Momose-mura [present Makino-cho, Takashima City]) who was working for Takashima regional office of Shiga Prefecture at that time as a worker for repairing roads and planted young trees, which he bought at his cost, during intervals of his work.
sen.cmt: sakuranamiki → sakura-namiki (row of cherry trees)planting → the planting
sen.e: The birth of this sakura-namiki (row of cherry trees) was begun five years before the planting by Kaizu-mura by Seishichi MUNETO (37 years old at that time; living in Momose-mura [present Makino-cho, Takashima City]) who was working for Takashima regional office of Shiga Prefecture at that time as a worker for repairing roads and planted young trees, which he bought at his cost, during intervals of his work.

sen.j: 宗戸は当時未舗装の県道の改良や補修を日常業務とし、助手2人とリヤカーに土砂を積んで毎日巡回し、くぼみに土砂を埋め、盛り上がっている場所を削って平らにするという作業に携わっていた。
sen.e: Muneto was engaged in daily work of improvement and repair of prefectural roads which were not paved at that time and carried out his works with two assistants by patrolling every day with a trailer for bicycle loaded with sand and filling sinkholes with sand and flatten mounds by scraping.

Muneto was engaged in daily work of improvement and repair of prefectural roads which were not paved at that time and carried out his works with two assistants by patrolling every day with a cart loaded with sand and filling sinkholes with sand and flatten mounds by scraping.

Muneto was engaged in daily work of improvement and repair of prefectural roads which were not paved at that time and carried out his works with two assistants by patrolling every day with a cart loaded with sand and filling sinkholes with sand and flatten mounds by scraping.

sen.j: 重労働の疲れを癒してくれたのが、道から見える澄み切った琵琶湖と沖に浮かぶ竹生島の姿であった。
sen.e: What shaked off his tiredness from exhausting labor was clear Lake Biwa and Chikubu-jima Islands off the coast which he could see from the road.
What shaked off his tiredness from exhausting labor was clear Lake Biwa and Chikubu-jima Islands off the coast which he could see from the road.
What shaked off his tiredness from exhausting labor was clear Lake Biwa and Chikubu-jima Islands off the coast which he could see from the road.

sen.j: 愛着のある道に何か残したいと思った彼は、桜の並木があれば景色が華やかになると考え、まったくの自力で桜を植え始めた。
sen.e: He wanted to leave something for roads to which he was strongly attached and commenced to plant cherry trees by himself believing that sakuranamiki would make the scenery brilliant.
He wanted to leave something for roads to which he was strongly attached and commenced to plant cherry trees by himself believing that sakura-namiki would make the scenery brilliant.
He wanted to leave something for roads to which he was strongly attached and commenced to plant cherry trees by himself believing that sakura-namiki would make the scenery brilliant.

sen.j: 3年後に若木が花をつけはじめると、村の青年団も協力しはじめた。
sen.e: Three years later, when young trees began to bear flowers, the young men's association of the village began to cooperate with him.
Three years later, when young trees began to bear flowers, the young men's association of the village began to cooperate with him.
Three years later, when young trees began to bear flowers, the young men's association of the village began to cooperate with him.

sen.j: 彼の指示で団員がリヤカーに水や土を運び、若木がしっかりと根付くよう丹精こめて植樹したのである。
sen.e: Under his instruction, member of the association carried water and soil with trailers for bicycle and plant young trees carefully so that trees could take root reliably.
Under his instruction, members of the association carried water and soil with carts and plant young trees carefully so that the trees could take root reliably.
sen.cmt: member → memberstrailers for bicycle → cartstrees → the trees
sen.e: Under his instruction, members of the association carried water and soil with carts and plant young trees carefully so that the trees could take root reliably.

sen.j: こうして、宗戸と村の若者たちが植えた桜がしっかりと根を下ろしたことが、現在の桜並木をつくる大きなきっかけとなったのである。
sen.e: Thus, the fact that cherry trees which Muneto and your people planted took root became a trigger for creation of the present sakuranamiki.
Thus, the fact that cherry trees which Muneto and young people planted took root became a trigger for creation of the present sakura-namiki.
Thus, the fact that cherry trees which Muneto and young people planted took root became a trigger for creation of the present sakura-namiki.

sen.j: その後も、地元の人々や観光関係者たちがこの桜並木を大切に育て、たび重なる豪雪やがけ崩れによる被害のさいにも黙々と補植し、守り続けた。
sen.e: After that, local people and people engaged in tourism fostered this sakuranamiki carefully and, when it was damaged by repeated heavy snowfall and mud and rock slide, they planted to supplement silently and continued to protect the sakuranamiki.

After that, local people and people engaged in tourism fostered this sakura-namiki carefully and, when it was damaged by repeated heavy snowfall and mud and rock slide, they planted to supplement silently and continued to protect the sakura-namiki.

After that, local people and people engaged in tourism fostered this sakura-namiki carefully and, when it was damaged by repeated heavy snowfall and mud and rock slide, they planted to supplement silently and continued to protect the sakura-namiki.

sen.j: 海津大崎の桜も還暦を過ぎ、樹勢もかつてのような勢いはなくなってきたが、マキノ地区住民の誇りとも言うべき桜並木は大切に守り育てられ、後世に引き継がれようとしている。
sen.e: Cherry trees of Kaizu-osaki exceeded the age of kanreki (60 years old) and they lost their strength to some extent, but sakuranamiki which is proud of by inhabitants of Makino district are protected and fostered with care and is being inherited to the following generations.

Cherry trees of Kaizu-osaki exceeded the age of kanreki (60 years old) and they lost their strength to some extent, but sakura-namiki which is proud of by inhabitants of Makino district are protected and fostered with care and is being inherited to the following generations.

Cherry trees of Kaizu-osaki exceeded the age of kanreki (60 years old) and they lost their strength to some extent, but sakura-namiki which is proud of by inhabitants of Makino district are protected and fostered with care and is being inherited to the following generations.

sen.j: 平成2年（1990年）3月、桜並木は財団法人日本さくらの会から「日本さくら名所100選」に選ばれ、日本各地から注目されるに至っている。
sen.e: In March 1990, the sakuranamiki was chosen as one of "100 best sakura viewing points in Japan" by Nihon Sakura no Kai (literally, association for cherry blossoms in Japan) and it arouse attention from various places in Japan.

In March 1990, the sakura-namiki was chosen as one of '100 best sakura viewing points in Japan' by Nihon Sakura no Kai Foundation (literally, association for cherry blossoms in Japan) and it arouse attention from various places in Japan.
sen.cmt: sakuranamiki → sakura-namiki" " → ' 'Foundation を追加しました。
sen.e: In March 1990, the sakura-namiki was chosen as one of '100 best sakura viewing points in Japan' by Nihon Sakura no Kai Foundation (literally, association for cherry blossoms in Japan) and it arouse attention from various places in Japan.

sen.j: 安土城の血天井
sen.e: Azuchijo no chitenjo (literally, blooded ceiling of Azuchi-jo Castle)
Azuchijo no chitenjo (literally, blooded ceiling of Azuchi-jo Castle)
Azuchijo no chitenjo (literally, blooded ceiling of Azuchi-jo Castle)

sen.j: 義経の隠れ岩
sen.e: Yoshitsune no kakureiwa (literally, rock for hiding for Yoshitsune)
Yoshitsune no kakureiwa (literally, rock for hiding for Yoshitsune)
Yoshitsune no kakureiwa (literally, rock for hiding for Yoshitsune)

sen.j: 桜並木
sen.e: Sakura-namiki
Sakura-namiki
Sakura-namiki

sen.j: 岩礁
sen.e: Shore reef
Shore reef
Shore reef

sen.j: 大崎寺
sen.e: Osaki-dera Temple
Osaki-dera Temple
Osaki-dera Temple

sen.j: JR湖西線マキノ駅下車、徒歩25分 ※桜シーズンのみ路線バスが運行
sen.e: 25 minutes from Makino Station of JR Kosei Line; * Only in the season of cherry blossoms, shuttle bus is operated.
25 minutes on foot from Makino Station of JR Kosei Line -- Shuttle bus service is available only during cherry blossom season.
sen.cmt: on footを追加しました。; * Only in the season of cherry blossoms, shuttle bus is operated → -- Shuttle bus service is available only during cherry blossom season
sen.e: 25 minutes on foot from Makino Station of JR Kosei Line -- Shuttle bus service is available only during cherry blossom season.

sen.j: 大阪駅から新快速で約1時間35～40分（特急列車「雷鳥 (列車)」を利用して近江今津駅で乗り換えた場合は約20～25分短縮される）
sen.e: One hour and 35 to 40 minutes from Osaka Station by Shin Kaisoku (new rapid service)(It can be shortened by 20 to 25 minutes by taking super express "Raicho" and changing train at Omi Imazu Station.)

One hour and 35 to 40 minutes from Osaka Station by Shin Kaisoku (new rapid service) (It can be shortened by 20 to 25 minutes by taking Limited Express 'Raicho' and changing train at Omi Imazu Station.)
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。super express → Limited Express" " → ' '
sen.e: One hour and 35 to 40 minutes from Osaka Station by Shin Kaisoku (new rapid service) (It can be shortened by 20 to 25 minutes by taking Limited Express 'Raicho' and changing train at Omi Imazu Station.)

sen.j: 桜の季節には観光船あり（今津港、長浜港から）。
sen.e: In the season of cherry blossoms, sightseeing ships are available (from Imazu Port and Nagahama Port)
In the season of cherry blossoms, sightseeing ships are available (from Imazu Port and Nagahama Port)
